description:
Originally developed by the NFDI4Health Task Force COVID-19, the Metadata Schema of the NFDI4Health contains a list of properties 
that describe a resource to be registered in the German Central Health Study Hub.  Currently, two main types of resources are distinguished: a) study descriptions (i.e., metadata set describing a study) and b) study documents. However, due to the generic character of the Metadata Schema, other types of resources may also be described and registered. The metadata properties are divided into mandatory and recommended ones. Along with bibliographic information such as title and description of the resource, the related persons and organizations contributing to the development of the resource can also be specified. The results of studies published in journal articles or other text publications can be linked too. For studies, information about study design and accessibility of the collected data should be additionally provided. The Metadata Schema consists mainly of properties adapted from established standards and models such as DataCite Metadata Schema 4.4, data models of the ClinicalTrials.gov, German Clinical Trials Register, International Clinical Trials Registry, HL7® FHIR, MIABIS, Maelstrom Research cataloguing toolkit and DDI Controlled Vocabularies. This is an updated version V3_3 of the Metadata Schema, which improves the modules of the previous version via refined display names, description and additional information texts, and short input helps and examples. The new version also introduces a new url item in the data sharing section for linking to data request applications. The undertaken changes are described within the document.

description: Simulated multi-sample metagenome data set including both long and short reads and created to prepare participants for the second CAMI challenge. Genomes included in this data set were selected from public dbs to match taxonomic profiles of simulated samples were matched to 16S rRNA profiles the guts of different mice, vendors and positions in the gut.
title: CAMI 2 - Multisample Benchmark Dataset of Mouse Gut
usageManual: The data can be temporarily downloaded via the https://frl.publisso.de/data/frl:6421672 link under "Zugehöriges Dataset". A direct download function with an extended tree view within this metadata record is planned for a later date. This does not affect the integrity of the data. The citation capability is fully ensured.

description: Within the NFDI4Health, three Research Data Management Plan templates have been developed to support researchers in planning their research projects. The template ‘Research Data Management Plan - Epidemiological studies’ is aimed at epidemiological research. Instructions for filling in the templates and explanations of the terms used in the templates can be found in the linked accompanying document ‘Research Data Management Plan templates - instructions for use’

title: EmiMin Emission dataset A (NH3, CO2, CH4, N2O, odour) from naturally ventilated dairy barn with manure-urine separation walking area floor system in the north of Germany
usageManual: Dataset is available in form of "ZIP" archive in delimiter-separated format (delimiter: ";") with dot "." as decimal marker. Filename extension: ".csv".nnDataset metadata is arranged in the "DATASET_METADATA" subdirectory.nMS Excel or a sophisticated database can be used to import tabular data.nnThere are local and time references in use. nLocal refrence fields are "LOCATION", "REFERENCE" and "REFERENCE_CODE".n- "LOCATION" is the root dataset code and main dataset key.n- "REFERENCE" stands for the type of a measurement object: building, compartment, pen.n- "REFERENCE_CODE" is a code to explicitly differentiate between multiple measurement objects of the same type.nTime reference fields are: "MEASUREMENT_PERIOD", "DATE_TIME", "START_DATE_TIME" and "END_DATE_TIME".n- "MEASUREMENT_PERIOD" stands for number of measurement time frame;n- "DATE_TIME" stands for either time stamp or time frame of a measurement (Format: "YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS");n- "START_DATE_TIME" stands for the start time point of an estimation; n- "END_DATE_TIME" stands for the end time point of an estimation;nLocal and time references can be used to merge different data sources.nnThe "RESULTS" subdirectory contains example of hourly emission calculation on the basis of linkage of asynchronously measured data sources.nnData types in use:nVARCHAR  Character Varying (VARCHAR(n)) up to n characters. Character Varying can contain either a text or a single predefined value or a ":" colon separated predefined value list.nDATETIME Datetime Type (DATETIME)nNUMERIC  Exact Numeric Types (NUMERIC(p, s)) nPrecision or p is an integer representing the total number of allowed digits in the specified column.nScale or s is also an integer value (s must be a value from 0 top, and its default value is 0) that is used to define the maximum number of decimal places allowed to the right or left of the decimal point. If the number is negative, the left decimal places are considered. Else, the right decimal places are considered.

description: In order to investigate the effect of Underfloor Scraper Faeces Urine Separation (USFUS) on the gaseous emission of hybrid- or naturally-ventilated pig fattening house measurements were carried out in fixed objects on four farms. nnThe Underfloor Scraper Faeces Urine Separation (USFUS) publication contains 4 datasets. Data sets A and B were measured in hybrid-ventilated houses and data sets C and D in naturally-ventilated houses.

description: To investigate the effect of floating Slurry Cooling Fins (SC) on the gaseous emissions of a mechanically ventilated fattening pig barn measurements were carried out simultaneously in a "case-control design" in two similar compartments with the same management but separate ventilation and manure systems. In only one of the two compartments, the Slurry Cooling Fins were implemented in the slurry channels under the slatted floor.Cooled water circulated through the fins and reduced the slurry temperature to < 15 °C. The other compartment served as a "control"-compartment without Slurry Cooling.  nnThe Slurry Cooling Fins (SC) publication contains 2 clusters of datasets and a total of 4 datasets. nThe first cluster includes two datasets A and B. The dataset B without SC provides the basis for dataset A to determine the emission reduction for the first cluster.nThe second cluster includes two datasets C and D. The dataset D without SC provides the basis for dataset C to determine the emission reduction for the second cluster.
fundingProgram: The project was supported by funds of the German Government\u2019s Special Purpose Fund held at Landwirtschaftliche Rentenbank

Filename extension: ".csv".nnDataset metadata is arranged in the "DATASET_METADATA" subdirectory.nMS Excel or a sophisticated database can be used to import tabular data.nnThere are local and time references in use. nLocal refrence fields are "LOCATION", "REFERENCE" and "REFERENCE_CODE".n- "LOCATION" is the root dataset code and main dataset key.n- "REFERENCE" stands for the type of a measurement object: building, compartment, pen.n- "REFERENCE_CODE" is a code to explicitly differentiate between multiple measurement objects of the same type.nTime reference fields are: "MEASUREMENT_PERIOD", "DATE_TIME", "START_DATE_TIME" and "END_DATE_TIME".n- "MEASUREMENT_PERIOD" stands for number of measurement time frame;n- "DATE_TIME" stands for either time stamp or time frame of a measurement (Format: "YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS");n- "START_DATE_TIME" stands for the start time point of an estimation; n- "END_DATE_TIME" stands for the end time point of an estimation;nLocal and time references can be used to merge different data sources.nnThe "RESULTS" subdirectory contains example of hourly emission calculation on the basis of linkage of asynchronously measured data sources.nnData types in use:nVARCHAR  Character Varying (VARCHAR(n)) up to n characters. Character Varying can contain either a text or a single predefined value or a ":" colon separated predefined value list.nDATETIME Datetime Type (DATETIME)nNUMERIC  Exact Numeric Types (NUMERIC(p, s)) nPrecision or p is an integer representing the total number of allowed digits in the specified column.nScale or s is also an integer value (s must be a value from 0 top, and its default value is 0) that is used to define the maximum number of decimal places allowed to the right or left of the decimal point. If the number is negative, the left decimal places are considered. Else, the right decimal places are considered.

description: The dataset contains data from 10 normal hearing listeners, 10 listeners with symmetric hearing loss, and 11 listeners with asymmetric hearing loss. 1_Sex_Age_HAuser_Asym_deltaPTA4.csv contains for each group general information as gender, age, hearing aid user and difference in pure tone average between the left and right ear which was used for grouping of the listeners with hearing loss. 2_AirConduction_Left.csv and 3_AirConduction_right.csv contains the air conduction thresholds from audiometry for the left and right ear, respectively. 4_BoneConduction_Left.csv and 5_BoneConduction_Right.csv contains the bone conduction thresholds from audiometry for the left and right ear, respectively. 6_Centralization.csv contains the CU values of a loudness matching paradigm as described in the reference. 7_BinauralFusion.csv contains the data of a binaural fusion experiment, where the listeners indicated from which direction the stimulus was perceived. 8_BinauralBroadbandLoudnessScaling.csv and 9_MonauralNarrowbandLoudnessScaling_Left_Right.csv contain loudness scaling data with presentation level and responses from the loudness scale in CU of different stimuli. All experiments and stimulus generation are described in detail in the referenced publication.

recordingPeriod: The data was collected during the Covid 19 pandemic in the period from January to July 2022.
title: Loudness and lateralization of binaural broadband noise for subjects with asymmetric hearing loss
usageManual:
The xlsx file serves to enhance readability, whereas the csv files solely meet the open file format requirements for reliable long-term archiving.
The xlsx file primarily uses three colors: blue for normal-hearing subjects, orange for subjects with symmetric hearing loss, and yellow for subjects with asymmetric hearing loss. 
In the centralization experiment, two lighter shades of these colors are used additionally. The color shades are used for indicating the three loudness categories (15 CU = dark, 25 CU = medium, 35 CU = light).
In the binaural fusion and lateralization experiment, one lighter shade for each color is used to indicate the response category, while the darker shade represents the loudness category.
In the binaural broadband loudness scaling experiment, one lighter shade for each color is used for the loudness category, while the darker shade represents the sound pressure level.
In the monaural narrowband loudness scaling experiment, three additional lighter shades are used for each color. The darkest shade indicates the loudness category for the right ear, the next lighter shade represents the sound pressure level for the right ear, the second lightest shade indicates the loudness category for the left ear, and the lightest shade represents the sound pressure level for the left ear.

description:
The Metadata Schema of the NFDI4Health and the NFDI4Health Task Force COVID-19  (Metadata Schema) contains a list of properties that describe a resource to be registered in the German Central Health Study Hub. Currently, two main types of resources are distinguished: a) study descriptions (i.e., metadata set describing a study) and b) study documents. However, due to the generic character of the Metadata Schema, other types of resources may also be described and registered. The metadata properties are divided into mandatory and recommended ones. Along with bibliographic information such as title and description of the resource, the related persons and organizations contributing to the development of the resource can also be specified. The results of studies published in journal articles or other text publications can be linked too. For studies, information about study design and accessibility of the collected data should be additionally provided. The Metadata Schema consists mainly of properties adapted from established standards and models such as DataCite Metadata Schema 4.4, data models of the ClinicalTrials.gov, German Clinical Trials Register, International Clinical Trials Registry, HL7® FHIR, MIABIS, Maelstrom Research cataloguing toolkit and DDI Controlled Vocabularies.
This is an updated version V2_1 of the Metadata Schema. The undertaken changes are described within the document.
fundingProgram: Flexibilisierte Förderung Bereich Wissenschaftliche Literaturversorgungs- und Informationssysteme (LIS)

description:
Data management plans are useful and essential tools for data and project organization.
Especially for complex projects over a longer running time with different stakeholders, institutions and disciplines, a huge diversity of data formats is generated and requires efficient data management and organization.
Apart from official specifications originating from project funders it is recommended to any project to maintain a data management plan. It fosters good data management and helps sticking to project guidelines and recommendations. 
This template stands out through its clear structure and optimization for a project consisting of many work packages or sub-projects of different disciplines. It is supposed to be used by individual project members. 
It originates from the patchCROP (www.landschaftslabor-patchcrop.de) project which is coordinated by ZALF (Leibniz Centre for Agricultural Landscape Research; www.zalf.de) and embedded in an interdisciplinary setting. It is expected to run over ten years. Within this experimental period, a huge and diverse amount of data will be a highly valuable outcome. 
Remarks on the use of the template: This template can be used and adapted to every project. The forwarding of project information filled into the template and the public use of these information should only happen according to the GDPR and checked every time this applies. 
For optimal usage, the DMP is updated once a year and by individual project members and updates are incorporated and verified by the project or data manager.
fundingProgram: EXC-2070 – 390732324 – PhenoRob

description: To investigate the effect of a Slurry Channel Reduction (SCR) on the gaseous emissions of a mechanically ventilated fattening pig barn measurements were carried out simultaneously in a "case-control design" in two similar compartments with the same management but separate ventilation and manure systems. In only one of the two compartments, a Slurry Channel Reduction was implemented with V-shaped trays under the slatted floor of the defecating and the drinking/feeding areas. The other compartment served as a "control"-compartment with common slurry channels under the two functional areas. In both compartments, a convex solid floor divided the two slatted areas.nnThe Slurry Channel Reduction (SCR) publication contains 2 clusters of datasets and a total of 4 datasets.nThe first cluster includes two datasets A and B. The dataset B without SCR provides the basis for dataset A to determine the emission reduction for the first cluster.nThe second cluster includes two datasets C and D. The dataset D without SCR provides the basis for dataset C to determine the emission reduction for the second cluster.
fundingProgram: The project was supported by funds of the German Government\u2019s Special Purpose Fund held at Landwirtschaftliche Rentenbank

Filename extension: ".csv".nnDataset metadata is arranged in the "DATASET_METADATA" subdirectory.nMS Excel or a sophisticated database can be used to import tabular data.nnThere are local and time references in use. nLocal refrence fields are "LOCATION", "REFERENCE" and "REFERENCE_CODE".n- "LOCATION" is the root dataset code and main dataset key.n- "REFERENCE" stands for the type of a measurement object: building, compartment, pen.n- "REFERENCE_CODE" is a code to explicitly differentiate between multiple measurement objects of the same type.nTime reference fields are: "MEASUREMENT_PERIOD", "DATE_TIME", "START_DATE_TIME" and "END_DATE_TIME".n- "MEASUREMENT_PERIOD" stands for number of measurement time frame;n- "DATE_TIME" stands for either time stamp or time frame of a measurement (Format: "YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS");n- "START_DATE_TIME" stands for the start time point of an estimation; n- "END_DATE_TIME" stands for the end time point of an estimation;nLocal and time references can be used to merge different data sources.nnThe "RESULTS" subdirectory contains example of hourly emission calculation on the basis of linkage of asynchronously measured data sources.nnData types in use:nVARCHAR  Character Varying (VARCHAR(n)) up to n characters. Character Varying can contain either a text or a single predefined value or a ":" colon separated predefined value list.nDATETIME Datetime Type (DATETIME)nNUMERIC  Exact Numeric Types (NUMERIC(p, s)) nPrecision or p is an integer representing the total number of allowed digits in the specified column.nScale or s is also an integer value (s must be a value from 0 top, and its default value is 0) that is used to define the maximum number of decimal places allowed to the right or left of the decimal point. If the number is negative, the left decimal places are considered. Else, the right decimal places are considered.

description: The project goal is to determine emission data from freely ventilated housings for dairy cows. A new type of grooved floor with an adapted scraper for planar walkways intends to reduce the generation of ammonia and thus the gaseous emissions of  of the livestock housing through the early separation of faeces and urine and more thorough removal. The objectives were to determine concentrations of significant airborne emissions in the incoming and outgoing air stream of the barn building, to collecte boundary and balance parameters for the calculation of emission factors and to determine emission factors. Three different dairy barns distributed throughout Germany were investigated. Ammonia concentration measurements were carried out 6 weeks before (dataset B, D, F) and 6 weeks after the implementation of the special floor system (dataset A, C, E). For the datasets C,D,E,F, the measurements on the associated locations were carried out for 2 weeks each during summer, the transitional period and winter. For the datasets A and B, the measurements at the associated location took place continuously over several months.

description:
The Metadata Schema of the NFDI4Health and the NFDI4Health Task Force COVID-19 (Metadata Schema) contains a list of properties that describe a resource to be registered in the German Central Health Study Hub. 
Currently, two main types of resources are distinguished: a) study descriptions (i.e., metadata set describing a study) and b) study documents. However, due to the generic character of the Metadata Schema, 
other types of resources may also be described and registered. The metadata properties are divided into mandatory and recommended ones. Along with bibliographic information such as title and description of the resource, 
the related persons and organizations contributing to the development of the resource can also be specified. The results of studies published in journal articles or other text publications can be linked too. 
For studies, information about study design and accessibility of the collected data should be additionally provided. The Metadata Schema consists mainly of properties adapted from established standards and models such as DataCite Metadata Schema 4.4, data models of the ClinicalTrials.gov, German Clinical Trials Register, International Clinical Trials Registry, HL7® FHIR, MIABIS, Maelstrom Research cataloguing toolkit and DDI Controlled Vocabularies.
This is an updated version V3_0 of the Metadata Schema, which in addition to the core module of previous versions, includes also two use case-specific modules for nutritional epidemiology and chronic diseases. The undertaken changes are described within the document.

Additional morphing from ED15 to N0. (2) Cardiac development (ED15, ED19, N0). Exemplified movies with 3-dimensional overview of the whole heart, 360° rotation and cross-section view of cardiac tissue (ED15, ED19 and N0). Additional morphing from ED15 to N0. (3) Hepatic development (ED15, ED19, N0). Exemplified movies with 3-dimensional overview of the whole liver, 360° rotation and cross-section view of hepatic tissue (ED15, ED19 and N0). Additional morphing from ED15 to N0.

Filename extension: ".csv".nnDataset metadata is arranged in the "DATASET_METADATA" subdirectory.nMS Excel or a sophisticated database can be used to import tabular data.nnThere are local and time references in use. nLocal refrence fields are "LOCATION", "REFERENCE" and "REFERENCE_CODE".n- "LOCATION" is the root dataset code and main dataset key.n- "REFERENCE" stands for the type of a measurement object: building, compartment, pen.n- "REFERENCE_CODE" is a code to explicitly differentiate between multiple measurement objects of the same type.nTime reference fields are: "MEASUREMENT_PERIOD", "DATE_TIME", "START_DATE_TIME" and "END_DATE_TIME".n- "MEASUREMENT_PERIOD" stands for number of measurement time frame;n- "DATE_TIME" stands for either time stamp or time frame of a measurement (Format: "YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS");n- "START_DATE_TIME" stands for the start time point of an estimation; n- "END_DATE_TIME" stands for the end time point of an estimation;nLocal and time references can be used to merge different data sources.nnThe "RESULTS" subdirectory contains example of hourly emission calculation on the basis of linkage of asynchronously measured data sources.nnData types in use:nVARCHAR  Character Varying (VARCHAR(n)) up to n characters. Character Varying can contain either a text or a single predefined value or a ":" colon separated predefined value list.nDATETIME Datetime Type (DATETIME)nNUMERIC  Exact Numeric Types (NUMERIC(p, s)) nPrecision or p is an integer representing the total number of allowed digits in the specified column.nScale or s is also an integer value (s must be a value from 0 top, and its default value is 0) that is used to define the maximum number of decimal places allowed to the right or left of the decimal point. If the number is negative, the left decimal places are considered. Else, the right decimal places are considered.

description: To investigate the effect of a Slurry Channel Reduction (SCR) in combination with Benzoic Acid as feed supplement on the gaseous emissions of a mechanically ventilated fattening pig barn measurements were carried out simultaneously in a "case-control design" in two similar compartments with the same management but separate ventilation and manure systems. In only one of the two compartments, a Slurry Channel Reduction was implemented with V-shaped trays under the slatted floor of the defecating and the drinking/feeding areas. The other compartment served as a "control"-compartment with common slurry channels under the two functional areas. In both compartments, a convex solid floor divided the two slatted areas. Benzoic Acid was used with 1 % as feed supplement in the case and the control compartment.nnThe Slurry Channel Reduction (SCR) and Benzoic Acid Application (BA) publication contains 2 clusters of datasets and a total of 4 datasets. nThe first cluster includes two datasets A and B. The dataset B with BA but without SCR provides the basis for dataset A to determine the emission reduction for the first cluster.nThe second cluster includes two datasets C and D. The dataset D with BA but without SCR provides the basis for dataset C to determine the emission reduction for the second cluster.
fundingProgram: The project was supported by funds of the German Government\u2019s Special Purpose Fund held at Landwirtschaftliche Rentenbank

description: The Metadata Schema of the NFDI4Health and the NFDI4Health Task Force COVID-19 (Metadata Schema) contains a list of properties that describe a resource to be registered in the German Central Health Study Hub. Currently, two main types of resources are distinguished: a) study descriptions (i.e., metadata set describing a study) and b) study documents. However, due to the generic character of the Metadata Schema, other types of resources may also be described and registered. The metadata properties are divided into mandatory and recommended ones. Along with bibliographic information such as title and description of the resource, the related persons and organizations contributing to the development of the resource can also be specified. The results of studies published in journal articles or other text publications can be linked too. For studies, information about study design and accessibility of the collected data should be additionally provided. The Metadata Schema consists mainly of properties adapted from established standards and models such as DataCite Metadata Schema 4.4, data models of the ClinicalTrials.gov, German Clinical Trials Register, International Clinical Trials Registry, HL7® FHIR, MIABIS, Maelstrom Research cataloguing toolkit and DDI Controlled Vocabularies. This is an updated version V3_1 of the Metadata Schema, which introduces two new resource types, namely registries and secondary data sources. Accordingly, the metadata set describing studies, which was part of the core module in previous versions, has been split into a separate module and adapted to also apply to registries and secondary data sources. An additional use case-specific module has also been added, including metadata specific to record linkage. The undertaken changes are described within the document.

description: The Metadata Schema of the NFDI4Health and the NFDI4Health Task Force COVID-19 (Metadata Schema) contains a list of properties that describe a resource to be registered in the German Central Health Study Hub. Currently, two main types of resources are distinguished: a) study descriptions (i.e., metadata set describing a study) and b) study documents. However, due to the generic character of the Metadata Schema, other types of resources may also be described and registered. The metadata properties are divided into mandatory and recommended ones. Along with bibliographic information such as title and description of the resource, the related persons and organizations contributing to the development of the resource can also be specified. The results of studies published in journal articles or other text publications can be linked too. For studies, information about study design and accessibility of the collected data should be additionally provided. The Metadata Schema consists mainly of properties adapted from established standards and models such as DataCite Metadata Schema 4.4, data models of the ClinicalTrials.gov, German Clinical Trials Register, International Clinical Trials Registry, HL7® FHIR, MIABIS, Maelstrom Research cataloguing toolkit and DDI Controlled Vocabularies. This is an updated version V3_2 of the Metadata Schema, which improves the modules of the previous version via refined description texts and added, deleted, moved, or renamed items. Additional use case-specific requirements, particularly for the chronic diseases and record linkage modules, have also been considered in this new version along with updating the list of sources. The undertaken changes are described within the document.

description: To investigate the effect of a Slurry Channel Reduction (SCR) in combination with Whey Application as slurry treatment on the gaseous emissions of a mechanically ventilated fattening pig barn measurements were carried out simultaneously in a "case-control design" in two similar compartments with the same management but separate ventilation and manure systems. In only one of the two compartments, a Slurry Channel Reduction was implemented with V-shaped trays under the slatted floor of the defecating and the drinking/feeding areas. The other compartment served as a "control"-compartment with common slurry channels under the two functional areas. In both compartments, a convex solid floor divided the two slatted areas. Whey was poured onto the slatted floor and the slurry surface of the defecating area in the case and the control compartment.nnThe Slurry Channel Reduction (SCR) and Whey Application (W) publication contains 2 clusters of datasets and a total of 4 datasets. nThe first cluster includes two datasets A and B. The dataset B with W but without SCR provides the basis for dataset A to determine the emission reduction for the first cluster.nThe second cluster includes two datasets C and D. The dataset D with W but without SCR provides the basis for dataset C to determine the emission reduction for the second cluster.

Filename extension: ".csv".nnDataset metadata is arranged in the "DATASET_METADATA" subdirectory.nMS Excel or a sophisticated database can be used to import tabular data.nnThere are local and time references in use. nLocal refrence fields are "LOCATION", "REFERENCE" and "REFERENCE_CODE".n- "LOCATION" is the root dataset code and main dataset key.n- "REFERENCE" stands for the type of a measurement object: building, compartment, pen.n- "REFERENCE_CODE" is a code to explicitly differentiate between multiple measurement objects of the same type.nTime reference fields are: "MEASUREMENT_PERIOD", "DATE_TIME", "START_DATE_TIME" and "END_DATE_TIME".n- "MEASUREMENT_PERIOD" stands for number of measurement time frame;n- "DATE_TIME" stands for either time stamp or time frame of a measurement (Format: "YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS");n- "START_DATE_TIME" stands for the start time point of an estimation; n- "END_DATE_TIME" stands for the end time point of an estimation;nLocal and time references can be used to merge different data sources.nnThe "RESULTS" subdirectory contains example of hourly emission calculation on the basis of linkage of asynchronously measured data sources.nnData types in use:nVARCHAR  Character Varying (VARCHAR(n)) up to n characters. Character Varying can contain either a text or a single predefined value or a ":" colon separated predefined value list.nDATETIME Datetime Type (DATETIME)nNUMERIC  Exact Numeric Types (NUMERIC(p, s)) nPrecision or p is an integer representing the total number of allowed digits in the specified column.nScale or s is also an integer value (s must be a value from 0 top, and its default value is 0) that is used to define the maximum number of decimal places allowed to the right or left of the decimal point. If the number is negative, the left decimal places are considered. Else, the right decimal places are considered.

description: In order to investigate the effect of a Urease Inhibitor Application (UIA) on the gaseous emission of a mechanically ventilated pig fattening house measurements were carried out simultaneously in a u201ccase-control designu201d in two similar compartments with the same management but separate ventilation and manure systems. During repeated experimental periods, UIA treatments (u201ccaseu201d) were alternately applied in only one of the two compartments, while the other served as a u201ccontrolu201d-compartment without treatment.nnThe Urease Inhibitor Application (UIA) publication contains 3 dataset clusters and 9 datasets on the whole. nThe first cluster includes two datasets A and B. The dataset B without UIA provides the basis for dataset A to determine the emission reduction for the first cluster.nThe second cluster includes two datasets C and D. The dataset D without UIA provides the basis for dataset C to determine the emission reduction for the second cluster .nThe third cluster contains five datasets E, F, G, H and I. The dataset E without UIA and the dataset F with only water application serve as basis for datasets G, H and I with different urease inhibitor applications to determine the emission reduction for the third cluster.
fundingProgram: The project was supported by funds of the German Government\u2019s Special Purpose Fund held at Landwirtschaftliche Rentenbank

description: In order to investigate the effect of a slatted floor with flaps on the gaseous emission of a natural ventilated dairy cattle cubicle housing measurements were carried out on four different farms. The slatted floor equipped with rubber inserts and emission reducing slit sealing flaps was installed in the barn for at least six months before the start of the measurements and for the entire duration of the investigations. The floor was cleaned by an automatic robot scraper with spraying equipment.rnThe Perforated Floor with Slit Sealing Flaps (SSF) publication contains four datasets (four different locations: A, B, C, D). Each dataset consists of six measuring periods (each for one week) in summer, winter and the transition period (emission measurement). Odor measurements were carried out in each season.
fundingProgram: The project was supported by funds of the German Government\u2019s Special Purpose Fund held at Landwirtschaftliche Rentenbank

description:
The NFDI4Health Task Force COVID-19 Metadata Schema Version 2_0 (Metadata Schema) contains a list of properties that describe a resource to be registered in the German Central Health Study Hub COVID-19 of the NFDI4Health Task Force COVID-19. Currently, two main types of resources are distinguished: a) study descriptions (i.e., metadata set describing a study) and b) study documents. However, due to the generic character of the Metadata Schema, other types of resources may also be described and registered.
The metadata properties are divided into mandatory and recommended ones. Along with bibliographic information such as title and description of a resource, the related persons and organizations contributing to the development of a resource can also be specified. The results of studies published in journal articles or other text publications can be linked too. For studies, information about study design and accessibility of the collected data should be additionally provided.
The Metadata Schema consists mainly of properties adapted from established standards and models such as DataCite Metadata Schema, data models of the ClinicalTrials.gov, German Clinical Trials Register, International Clinical Trials Registry, HL7® FHIR, MIABIS, Maelstrom Research cataloguing toolkit and DDI Controlled Vocabularies.
fundingProgram: Flexibilisierte Förderung Bereich Wissenschaftliche Literaturversorgungs- und Informationssysteme (LIS)

title: EmiMin Emission dataset B (NH3, CO2, CH4, N20) from hybrid-ventilated fattening pig housings with an underfloor scraper in multi area pens with slatted and solid floor and semi liquid manure system
usageManual: Dataset is available in form of "ZIP" archive in delimiter-separated format (delimiter: ";") with dot "." as decimal marker. Filename extension: ".csv".nnDataset metadata is arranged in the "DATASET_METADATA" subdirectory.nMS Excel or a sophisticated database can be used to import tabular data.nnThere are local and time references in use. nLocal refrence fields are "LOCATION", "REFERENCE" and "REFERENCE_CODE".n- "LOCATION" is the root dataset code and main dataset key.n- "REFERENCE" stands for the type of a measurement object: building, compartment, pen.n- "REFERENCE_CODE" is a code to explicitly differentiate between multiple measurement objects of the same type.nTime reference fields are: "MEASUREMENT_PERIOD", "DATE_TIME", "START_DATE_TIME" and "END_DATE_TIME".n- "MEASUREMENT_PERIOD" stands for number of measurement time frame;n- "DATE_TIME" stands for either time stamp or time frame of a measurement (Format: "YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS");n- "START_DATE_TIME" stands for the start time point of an estimation; n- "END_DATE_TIME" stands for the end time point of an estimation;nLocal and time references can be used to merge different data sources.nnThe "RESULTS" subdirectory contains example of hourly emission calculation on the basis of linkage of asynchronously measured data sources.nnData types in use:nVARCHAR  Character Varying (VARCHAR(n)) up to n characters. Character Varying can contain either a text or a single predefined value or a ":" colon separated predefined value list.nDATETIME Datetime Type (DATETIME)nNUMERIC  Exact Numeric Types (NUMERIC(p, s)) nPrecision or p is an integer representing the total number of allowed digits in the specified column.nScale or s is also an integer value (s must be a value from 0 top, and its default value is 0) that is used to define the maximum number of decimal places allowed to the right or left of the decimal point. If the number is negative, the left decimal places are considered. Else, the right decimal places are considered.

description: To investigate the effect of a Slurry Channel Reduction (SCR) in combination with Nutrition Reduced Feeding and Benzoic Acid as feed supplement on the gaseous emissions of a mechanically ventilated fattening pig barn measurements were carried out simultaneously in a "case-control design" in two similar compartments with the same management but separate ventilation and manure systems. In only one of the two compartments, a Slurry Channel Reduction was implemented with V-shaped trays under the slatted floor of the defecating and the drinking/feeding areas. The other compartment served as a "control"-compartment with common slurry channels under the two functional areas. In both compartments, a convex solid floor divided the two slatted areas. Nutrition Reduced Feeding in combination with Benzoic Acid was used in the case and the control compartment.nnThe Slurry Channel Reduction (SCR) and Nutrition Reduced Feeding (NPR) with Benzoic Acid Application (BA) publication contains 2 clusters of datasets and a total of 4 datasets. nThe first cluster includes two datasets A and B. The dataset B with BA and NPR but without SCR provides the basis for dataset A to determine the emission reduction for the first cluster.nThe second cluster includes two datasets C and D. The dataset D with BA and NPR but without SCR provides the basis for dataset C to determine the emission reduction for the second cluster.

Filename extension: ".csv".nnDataset metadata is arranged in the "DATASET_METADATA" subdirectory.nMS Excel or a sophisticated database can be used to import tabular data.nnThere are local and time references in use. nLocal refrence fields are "LOCATION", "REFERENCE" and "REFERENCE_CODE".n- "LOCATION" is the root dataset code and main dataset key.n- "REFERENCE" stands for the type of a measurement object: building, compartment, pen.n- "REFERENCE_CODE" is a code to explicitly differentiate between multiple measurement objects of the same type.nTime reference fields are: "MEASUREMENT_PERIOD", "DATE_TIME", "START_DATE_TIME" and "END_DATE_TIME".n- "MEASUREMENT_PERIOD" stands for number of measurement time frame;n- "DATE_TIME" stands for either time stamp or time frame of a measurement (Format: "YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS");n- "START_DATE_TIME" stands for the start time point of an estimation; n- "END_DATE_TIME" stands for the end time point of an estimation;nLocal and time references can be used to merge different data sources.nnThe "RESULTS" subdirectory contains example of hourly emission calculation on the basis of linkage of asynchronously measured data sources.nnData types in use:nVARCHAR  Character Varying (VARCHAR(n)) up to n characters. Character Varying can contain either a text or a single predefined value or a ":" colon separated predefined value list.nDATETIME Datetime Type (DATETIME)nNUMERIC  Exact Numeric Types (NUMERIC(p, s)) nPrecision or p is an integer representing the total number of allowed digits in the specified column.nScale or s is also an integer value (s must be a value from 0 top, and its default value is 0) that is used to define the maximum number of decimal places allowed to the right or left of the decimal point. If the number is negative, the left decimal places are considered. Else, the right decimal places are considered.
